name: element
content:
element noun
(PART)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ C ] a part of something: List the elements that make up a perfect dinner party. The movie had all the elements of a good thriller. We weren't even taught the elements of (= basic information about) physics at school.
More examplesFewer examplessubversive elements in societyAll these different political elements have somehow been yoked together to form a new alliance.They've introduced all sorts of new elements to that programme in order to broaden its appeal.Reactionary elements in the industry are preventing its progress towards greater efficiency.The television adverts were, of course, an important element of the campaign.

element noun
(ELECTRICAL PART)
[ C ] the part of an electrical device that produces heat: a heating element The kettle needs a new element.
[ C, C ] (UK usually ring) a circular piece of material often made of metal that can be heated in order to be used for cooking: a gas element an electric element
